message.content: This question requires knowledge about the habitat and characteristics of polar bears. Polar bears are specifically adapted for living in cold environments and are best suited for colder places. Option (B) is incorrect because polar bears are not suited for hotter regions as they are adapted for cold climates. Option (C) is incorrect because polar bears are found in the Arctic and not on Jupiter's polar caps. Option (D) is incorrect because polar bears are not adapted for desert regions and require access to sea ice and marine food sources.

Their thick fur and layer of blubber help them to stay warm in freezing temperatures. Option (B) is incorrect because polar bears would not be suited for hotter regions as they are adapted to the cold. Option (C) is incorrect because Jupiter's polar caps are not suitable for any living organisms. Option (D) is also incorrect because polar bears would not be suited for desert regions as they rely on icy environments for hunting and survival.
